thread.title: US Sports Camps to Host Nike Cal Men's and Women's 2016 Winter Lacrosse Camps
thread.title_full: US Sports Camps to Host Nike Cal Men's and Women's 2016 Winter Lacrosse Camps

author: Steve Pence
title: US Sports Camps to Host Nike Cal Men's and Women's 2016 Winter Lacrosse Camps
text:
The Nike Cal Women’s Winter Lacrosse Camp, taking place January 2-4, offers players from around the country a unique opportunity to advance their skills at Memorial Stadium on the beautiful campus of UC-Berkeley. Directing the girl’s camp is Brooke Eubanks, California’s Head Women’s Lacrosse Coach. "Hosting our Winter Lacrosse Camp provides players a great opportunity to improve on multiple areas of their game prior to the seasons start,” says Coach Eubanks. Currently in her second season at Cal, Coach Eubanks leads the Golden Bears program after a successful tenure with the Stanford Cardinal Women’s Lacrosse Team. Assisting Coach Eubanks at the Winter Lacrosse Camp includes assistants Kacie Lewis, a four-year letter winner at UConn, and former Golden Bear standout, Megan Takacs.
The Cal Women’s Winter Lacrosse Camp is designed for girls ages 13-18 and focuses on advanced skills, position play, team concepts, and an overall intense level of competition. The program also offers goalie specific training, consisting of the development of their positioning, stick handling, and situational game management. Campers will compete in daily scrimmages to implement the skill work they learned throughout the day in a competitive environment.
This extended-day program includes a total of six field sessions over three days. Suggested hotel accommodations include, The Claremont Hotel as well as Hotel Durant, both located in close proximity to the UC Berkeley campus.
The Nike Cal Men’s Winter Lacrosse Clinic takes place January 9-10 and offers players ages 8-18 the opportunity to improve their skills in a competitive environment. The two-day program runs from 9:00am-3:00pm daily at the newly renovated Maxwell Field.
The clinic is directed by Golden Bear Men’s Lacrosse Coach, Ned Webster along with his UC Berkeley coaching staff and current players. Designed for emerging and elite high school players, stick work, individual attacking and defensive skills as well as team attack and defensive concepts will be covered during the clinic. In addition, campers will have the opportunity to take a tour of The UC Berkeley Campus and Memorial Stadium.
Coaches, Parents, and Campers interested in Nike Lacrosse Camps can visit http://www.ussportscamps.com or call 1-800-645-3226.
About US Sports Camps
US Sports Camps (USSC) , headquartered in San Rafael, California, is America's largest sports camp network and the licensed operator of Nike Sports Camps. The company has offered camps since 1975 with the same mission that defines it today: to shape a lifelong enjoyment of athletics through high quality sports education and skill enhancement.
